ubm:variation.name: defaultValueInInstance
ubm:variation.description: Default values are present in the instance context, to raise xbrldie:DefaultValueUsedInInstanceError.

ubm:variation.name: defaultValueInInstanceOK
ubm:variation.description: Default values aren't present in the instance context.

ubm:variation.name: combinationOfCubesCase1Segment
ubm:variation.description: Fig. 3 (line 1) One cube, all-valid: result-true.

ubm:variation.name: combinationOfCubesCase6Segment
ubm:variation.description: Fig. 3 (line 4) One cube, all-invalid: result-false.

ubm:variation.name: combinationOfCubesCase2Segment
ubm:variation.description: Fig. 3 (line 5) One cube, notAll-valid: result-false.

ubm:variation.name: combinationOfCubesCase3Segment
ubm:variation.description: Fig. 3 (line 3) Two cubes, all-valid, notAll-invalid: result-true.

ubm:variation.name: combinationOfCubesCase4Segment
ubm:variation.description: Fig. 3 (line 2) One cube, notAll-invalid: result-true.

ubm:variation.name: combinationOfCubesCase5Segment
ubm:variation.description: Fig. 3 (line 6) Two cubes, all-valid, notAll-valid: result-false: cubes are equivalent so are both satisfied.

ubm:variation.name: contextForbiddenExplicitDimInSegment
ubm:variation.description: Fig. 3 (6) Two cubes, all-valid, notAll-valid: result-false: Two fact values have separate contexts with segment dimensions, one (merlot/Japan) meets all hypercube and fails notAll and thus is ok, the second (sedan/UnitedKingdom) meets the condition of the notAll hypercube and thus is a forbidden dimension.

ubm:variation.name: contextForbiddenExplicitDimMemberInScenario
ubm:variation.description: Fig. 3 (6) Two cubes, all-valid, notAll-valid: result-false: Two fact values have separate contexts with scenario dimensions, one (merlot/Japan) meets all hypercube and fails notAll and thus is ok, the second (sedan/UnitedKingdom) meets the condition of the notAll hypercube and thus is a forbidden dimension.

ubm:variation.name: contextImplicitDimNotInSegment
ubm:variation.description: A typed dimension which should be in the segment is instead in the scenario, and the hypercube is not closed, by 3.1.3.1 #2 making the hypercube invalid, thus raising error.

ubm:variation.name: contextImplicitDimNotInScenario
ubm:variation.description: A typed dimension which should be in the scenario is instead in the segment, and the hypercube is not closed.

ubm:variation.name: contextExplicitDimNotInSegment
ubm:variation.description: An explicit dimension which should be in the segment is instead in the scenario, and the hypercube is not closed.

ubm:variation.name: contextExplicitDimNotInScenario
ubm:variation.description: An explicit dimension which should be in the scenario is instead in the segment, and the hypercube is not closed.

ubm:variation.name: combinationOfCubesUnusableMemberInvalid
ubm:variation.description: Two dimensions, one member (Merlot)'s dimension-domain was prohibited and replaced with an unusable dimension-domain.

ubm:variation.name: combinationOfCubesUnusableDomainInvalid
ubm:variation.description: Two dimensions, products domain is unusable.

ubm:variation.name: closedEmptyHypercubeIsValid
ubm:variation.description: Point 3.1.3 Fig 4 row 1

ubm:variation.name: openEmptyHypercubeIsValid
ubm:variation.description: Point 3.1.3 Fig 4 row 2

ubm:variation.name: closedEmptyHypercubeIsInvalid
ubm:variation.description: Point 3.1.3 Fig 4 row 3. It is invalid because the hypercube is closed and contains non expected information

ubm:variation.name: closedNotEmptyHypercubeIsValid
ubm:variation.description: Point 3.1.3 Fig 4 row 4. No extra information is found

ubm:variation.name: closedNotEmptyHypercubeIsInvalid
ubm:variation.description: Point 3.1.3 Fig 4 row 5. It is invalid because the hypercube is closed and contains non expected information

ubm:variation.name: openNotEmptyHypercubeIsValid
ubm:variation.description: Point 3.1.3 Fig 4 row 6. It is valid because the hypercube is open

ubm:variation.name: InstanceValidAccordingToTwoDimensionalTaxonomies
ubm:variation.description: The instance is valid because hypercubes are open

ubm:variation.name: InstanceInvalidAccordingToTwoDimensionalTaxonomies
ubm:variation.description: The instance is invalid because hypercubes are closed

ubm:variation.name: InstanceInvalidTheValueIsNotADomainMember
ubm:variation.description: The paragraph above Figure 2 in the XDT spec excludes the member element that has been used in the instance

ubm:variation.name: InstanceInvalidTheValueIsNotADomainMemberCase2
ubm:variation.description: The paragraph above Figure 2 in the XDT spec excludes the member element that has been used in the instance

ubm:variation.name: ComplexHypercubeInheritance
ubm:variation.description: Example 11 of the spec shows how inheritance should work. The instance is valid according to hypercubes in link1 (Default link)

ubm:variation.name: ComplexHypercubeInheritance2
ubm:variation.description: Example 11 of the spec shows how inheritance should work, The instance is valid according to hypercubes in link2 extended link role

ubm:variation.name: ComplexHypercubeInheritance3
ubm:variation.description: Example 11 of the spec shows how inheritance should work, The instance is Dimensionally invalid secondChildren and thirdChildren at lease must have dimensional information

ubm:variation.name: memberExcludedFromValidDomain1
ubm:variation.description: The effective domain contains the same element twice. That element must be excluded from the domain because it has xbrldt:usable=false in one of the domains.

ubm:variation.name: memberExcludedFromValidDomain2
ubm:variation.description: The effective domain contains the same element twice. That element must be excluded from the domain because it has xbrldt:usable=false in one of the domains.

ubm:variation.name: contextContainsTypedDimensionValid
ubm:variation.description: 1. A context MUST NOT contain more than one dimension value for every dimension. A validator MUST signal [Ins Err, 7] xbrldie:RepeatedDimensionInInstance when this rule is violated. In this valid variation only one dimension value is provided.

ubm:variation.name: contextContainsRepeatedDimension
ubm:variation.description: 1. A context MUST NOT contain more than one dimension value for every dimension. A validator MUST signal [Ins Err, 7] xbrldie:RepeatedDimensionInInstance when this rule is violated. In this case two customer names are provided for the same context segment.

ubm:variation.name: typedMemberIsExplicitInvalid
ubm:variation.description: The content of the xlink:href attribute of a xbrldi:typedMember element MUST resolve to an typed dimension within the DTS of the instance document. A dimensional processor MUST raise an error [Ins Err, 8] xbrldie:TypedMemberNotTypedDimension if the content of the xlink:href attribute of xbrldi:explicitMember resolves (with xml:base) to anything other than a typed dimension declaration. In this case it resolves to an explicit dimension.

ubm:variation.name: contextMemberNotExplicitDimension
ubm:variation.description: The content of the xlink:href attribute of an xbrldi:explicitMember element MUST resolve to an explicit dimension within the DTS of the instance document. In this case it resolves to a hypercube element instead. The usual hypercube arc from primary item is not present in this test, to prevent missing dimension errors from also being detected.

ubm:variation.name: contextExplicitDimDomainMemberNotFound
ubm:variation.description: The explicit dimension has a qName which doesn't correspond to an element declaration in the DTS of the instance.
